setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

cards.name: Blaziken
cards.text: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Blaziken. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cresselia
cards.text: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Moon Twinkle
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Cresselia.

attacks.name: Lunar Dance
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Cresselia. If you do, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Darkrai
cards.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Reach Over
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Darkness Pursuit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Cresselia, this attack's base damage is 100.

cards.name: Darkrai
cards.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Darkness Roar
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 or his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Hole
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, that Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Smash Short
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. Discard that Pokémon Tool card, look at your opponent's hand, and discard any Pokémon Tool cards of the same name you find there.

cards.name: Porygon-Z

abilities.name: Conversion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a basic Energy card from your hand. Porygon-Z is the same type as that Energy Card until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Rotom
cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Telebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Sceptile

abilities.name: Wild Growth
abilities.text: Each basic Grass Energy card attached to your Grass Pokémon provides GrassGrass Energy instead. You can't use more than 1 Wild Growth Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Swampert

abilities.name: Wash Out
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Water or Fighting Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Swampert is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

attacks.name: Power Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each basic Energy card attached to Tangrowth to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Tangrowth. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Togekiss from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 10 cards of your deck, choose as many basic Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.

attacks.name: Air Scroll
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from Togekiss.

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cotton Cloud
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Altaria by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

attacks.name: Band Attack
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Beedrill you have in play.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

attacks.name: Parallel Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from 1 of your Pokémon the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dozing Scales
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Claydol

abilities.name: Cosmic Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your hand and put them on the bottom of your deck in any order. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Exploud
cards.text: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

attacks.name: Ambient Noise
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If the first coin is heads, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If the first coin is tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If the second coin is tails, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Houndoom
cards.text: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

attacks.name: Dark Fang
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Black Fire
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire or Darkness Energy attached to Houndoom. If you discard a Fire Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Hypno
cards.text: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even if someone just woke up.

attacks.name: Dream Catcher
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, move all damage counters from Hypno to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Kingler
cards.text: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

attacks.name: Scissor Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon would be be Knocked Out by this attack, Kingler does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Carry In
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon Tool Card, a Supporter card, and a basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Latias
cards.text: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

attacks.name: Miraculous Light
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Latias.

attacks.name: Mist Ball
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Latias.

cards.name: Latios
cards.text: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios.

cards.name: Mawile
cards.text: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

attacks.name: Pick Out
attacks.text: Choose 1 face-down Prize card (yours or your opponent's) and put it face up. If that card is a Supporter card, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (That card remains face up for the rest of the game.)

attacks.name: Jaw Bite
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Milotic

abilities.name: Marvel Scale
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Milotic by your opponent's Pokémon LV.X.

cards.text: When people bicker, it is said to arise from the depths of lakes to becalm violent hearts.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Transback
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

cards.name: Primeape

abilities.name: Anger Point
abilities.text: If Primeape has any damage counters on it, Primeape's attacks do 40 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

attacks.name: Whump
attacks.text: Primeape is now Confused. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Trump Card
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, Slowking's Psych Up attack's base damage is 60.

cards.name: Unown [H]

abilities.name: HEAL
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown H, Unown E, Unown A, and Unown L on your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Wailord

abilities.name: Sleeping Pulse
abilities.text: As long as Wailord remains Asleep between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Wailord.

cards.text: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

attacks.name: Sink Deep
attacks.text: If Wailord has any damage counters on it, Wailord is now Asleep.

cards.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Toxic Virus
abilities.text: At any time between turns, each player puts 1 more damage counter on his or her Poisoned Pokémon.

cards.text: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

attacks.name: Offensive Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Wigglytuff

abilities.name: Good Night Melody
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Wigglytuff is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

attacks.name: Ballon Attack
attacks.text: If Igglybuff is anywhere under Wigglytuff, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Arbok
cards.text: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

attacks.name: Deadly Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage. If the Defending Pokémon is not Poisoned, that Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Cacturne
cards.text: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Needle Arm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Combusken
cards.text: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of Combusken's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Delibird
cards.text: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

attacks.name: Present
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: It floats using its well-developed floatation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Floatzel during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aqua Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gorebyss
cards.text: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.

attacks.name: Sweet Temptation
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Snap
attacks.text: If Gorebyss has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Granbull
cards.text: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

cards.name: Grovyle
cards.text: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

attacks.name: Greenness
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Hariyama
cards.text: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

attacks.name: Palm Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Spirited Throw
attacks.text: If Hariyama has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 80.

cards.name: Huntail
cards.text: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Threaten and Drop
attacks.text: If Huntail has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Linoone
cards.text: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

attacks.name: Switcheroo
attacks.text: Move a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already has a Pokémon Tool attached to it). (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Loudred
cards.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

attacks.name: Bass Control
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Magcargo

abilities.name: Magma Armor
abilities.text: Magcargo can't be Asleep or Paralyzed.

cards.text: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.

attacks.name: Lava Plume
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Marshtomp
cards.text: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.

attacks.name: Muddy Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Metapod is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Metapod and put it onto Metapod. (This counts as evolving Metapod.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Metapod is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

cards.name: Pelipper
cards.text: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.

attacks.name: Guzzle
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to Pelipper. Remove 2 damage counters for each Energy card attached in this way.

attacks.name: Jet Return
attacks.text: Does 30 times the number of Energy cards attached to Pelipper. Then, put all Energy cards attached to Pelipper on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Porygon2

abilities.name: Download
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Supporter card from your hand and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.

cards.name: Purugly
cards.text: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Relicanth
cards.text: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

attacks.name: Primal Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Trainer Cards that have Fossil in their names, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sleep Swirl
attacks.text: Both Relicanth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

cards.name: Seviper
cards.text: For many generations, it has feuded with ZANGOOSE. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.

attacks.name: Tail Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.

attacks.name: Air Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Skarmory by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Slowbro
cards.text: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the SHELLDER on its tail bites down.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Togetic
cards.text: It is said to appear in front of kindly people to scatter a glowing down called "joy dust."

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Unown [F]

abilities.name: FAKE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown F is on your Bench, you may use this power. Put a coin next to your Active Pokémon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. Your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, draw a card.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack's base damage is 30.

cards.name: Unown [G]

abilities.name: GUARD
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown G is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown G and attach Unown G to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown G is attached to a Pokémon, prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to that Pokémon.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: If Unown G has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zangoose
cards.text: It has feuded with SEVIPER for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.

attacks.name: Cutting Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent has Seviper in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 50 more damage.

cards.name: Baltoy
cards.text: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

attacks.name: Psychic Balance
attacks.text: If you have less cards in your hand than your opponent, draw cards until you have the same number of cards as your opponent. (If you have more or the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch Baltoy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.

cards.name: Cacnea
cards.text: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive 30 days without water.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Caterpie

abilities.name: Pupate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Caterpie is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Caterpie and put it onto Caterpie. (This counts as evolving Caterpie.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Caterpie is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

cards.name: Clamperl
cards.text: It makes a single pearl during its lifetime. The pearl is said to amplify psychic power.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Ekans.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Feebas
cards.text: It is famous for its shabby appearance. While populous, they tend to cluster in set locations.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Glameow
cards.text: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Houndour
cards.text: It conveys its feelings using different cries. It works in a pack to cleverly take down prey.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Houndour.

cards.name: Igglybuff

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jigglypuff from your hand onto Igglybuff (this counts as evolving Igglybuff) and remove all damage counters from Igglybuff.

cards.text: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.

attacks.name: Inquire
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you didn't play any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, draw 2 more cards.

cards.name: Illumise

abilities.name: Scent Conduct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Illumise is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: With its sweet aroma, it guides VOLBEAT to draw signs with light in the night sky.

attacks.name: Firefly Scent
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Bodies, that Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Jigglypuff by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Kakuna by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Krabby
cards.text: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

cards.name: Lunatone

abilities.name: Gravity Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a card from your hand. Then, if you have Solrock in play, draw a card. This power can't be used if Lunatone is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

cards.name: Luvdisc
cards.text: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

attacks.name: Rendezvous
attacks.text: Reveal the top card of your deck and put it into your hand. If that card is a Pokémon, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Synchro Dance
attacks.text: If Luvdisc and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Makuhita
cards.text: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

attacks.name: Arm Thrust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

cards.name: Mudkip
cards.text: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Porygon
cards.text: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Slowpoke. Slowpoke is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tumble Over
attacks.text: Slowpoke can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Slugma
cards.text: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Sunlight
abilities.text: If you have Lunatone in play, damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by your Psychic or Fighting Pokémon isn't affected by resistance.

cards.text: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.

attacks.name: Sol Charge
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: Its wings are like cotton tufts. If it perches on someone's head, it looks like a cotton hat.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swablu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.

attacks.name: Vine Invite
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the the Retreat Cost).

cards.name: Togepi
cards.text: Its shell is said to be stuffed with happiness that it shares with kindhearted people.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Torchic
cards.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Treecko
cards.text: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Treecko but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Treecko.

cards.name: Unown [L]

abilities.name: LINK
abilities.text: Unown L can use any attack from any Unown in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search either player's discard pile for up to any 2 cards, show them to your opponent, and put them on top of that player's deck in any order you like.

cards.name: Volbeat

abilities.name: Light Conduct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Illumise in play, you may search your discard pile for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. This power can't be used if Volbeat is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves ILLUMISE's sweet aroma.

attacks.name: Firefly Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Whismur
cards.text: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs.  If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Wingull
cards.text: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.

cards.name: Zigzagoon
cards.text: It walks in zigzag fashion. It is good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.

attacks.name: Pull Out
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Amulet Coin
cards.text: Attach Amulet Coin to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,If the Pokémon Amulet Coin is attached to is your Active Pokémon at the end of your turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Felicity's Drawing
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. If you discard 1 card, draw 3 cards. If you discard 2 cards, draw 4 cards.

cards.name: Leftovers
cards.text: Attach Leftovers to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,If the Pokémon Leftovers is attached to is your Active Pokémon at the end of your turn, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon.

cards.name: Moonlight Stadium
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,The Retreat Cost for each Psychic and Darkness Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.

cards.name: Premier Ball
cards.text: Search your deck or your discard pile for a Pokémon LV.X, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If you search your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Rare Candy
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cresselia LV.X

abilities.name: Full Moon Dance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokémon to another Pokémon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Cresselia is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Cresselia. Cresselia LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Moon Skip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.name: Darkrai LV.X

abilities.name: Dark Shadow
abilities.text: Each basic Darkness Energy card attached to your Darkness Pokémon now has the effect "If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance)." You can't use more than 1 Dark Shadow Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Darkrai. Darkrai LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Endless Darkness
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Defending Pokémon is still Asleep. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Dialga LV.X

abilities.name: Time Skip
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your turn ends. If both of them are tails, after your opponent draws a card at the beginning of his or her next turn, his or her turn ends. This power can't be used if Dialga is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Dialga. Dialga LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Metal Flash
attacks.text: During your next turn, Dialga can't use Metal Flash.

cards.name: Palkia LV.X

abilities.name: Restructure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, you switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Palkia is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Palkia. Palkia LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Hydro Reflect
attacks.text: You may move all Energy cards attached to Palkia to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)
